questions.question_text: A SAN serves out storage to a company's virtual environment and provides low-level disk access. The company wants to use its existing IP network and equipment to access the virtual disks. Which of the following network connection types would BEST accomplish this task?

discussion.content: iSCSI transports packets across TCP/IP networks. The iSCSI target is the remote storage, which appears to the host system as a local drive. The iSCSI protocol links the hosts and storage over IP networks: LAN, WAN, and Internet.

comments.content: ma che caracacazzzo vuol dire bro?

Nope thats Fiber Channel over Ethernet (FCoE) which is completely different from FC. The reason why it's not the answer is not because it's using Ethernet, but because it requires specialized hardware for a fabric switched topology. Lol people be really just upvoting a wrong answer.
"existing IP network and equipment" means existing physical, data link, network layers.
Fiber channel uses Ethernet not IP

discussion.content: Why isci and not FC? How do we assume the existing infrastructure is isci?
MIB is part of Network plus exam?

comments.content: Yes, its part of the exam

questions.question_text: When using a network monitoring system, a network technician notices that a switch returns many object identifiers that do not have descriptions. Which of the following should be imported into the monitoring system to describe these object identifiers?

discussion.content: In case anyone might be wondering why not firewall settings, the question states "many of them are not receiving a response". If it were firewall settings, none of them would receive a response. Some of them HAVE received a response and an IP so the firewall settings are good, thus the cause is DHCP exhaustion.

questions.question_text: A company hires some temporary workers. On day one, the temporary employees report they are unable to connect to the network. A network technician uses a packet analysis tool and finds that many clients are continuously sending out requests for an IP address, but many of them are not receiving a response. Which of the following could be the cause of this issue?

choices.D: Disabled unnecessary services on the network switches
choices.A: Changed the default credentials on the network switches

questions.question_text: A network administrator is responding to a help desk ticket, which states an unknown wireless access point is broadcasting in a specific area. Upon investigation, the administrator finds that a user brought a wireless access point from home and plugged it into the corporate network. This resulted in an attacker using the unsecured wireless LAN to gain access to the network. Which of the following should the network administrator have done to BEST prevent this problem?

discussion.content: This is a common CCNA question. Not sure if it's in comptia
100Mb connection only uses pins 1236. 1/10 Gb uses all 8 pins.
It shows that the pins 7 & 8 aren't connected, so shouldn't the answer be A?

comments.content: Port is shutdown by the looks of things, I assume the 'no shut' command was not issued on the port on assignment
